content:
Hello,

I was trying to figure out a way to query the resource identifier based on the input search parameter using the 'contains' option in order to search a part of the identifier value. So I used the query as follows: [base]/MedicationKnowledge?_identifier = 12345XX9876542-2020 and to my surprise it fetched all the MedicationKnowledge resources where identifier.value contains '12345XX9876542-2020'. Is this a valid query or some erroneous query? My understanding was that we cannot perform a 'contains' in token datatypes. I performed this in HAPI. Your feedback would be highly appreciated. Thank you !
A server may well support features not described in the FHIR spec.

What SearchParameter was declared in their CapabilityStatement? So long as the search performed aligns with the SearchParameter declared, it's fine. However, if they're referencing a standard HL7 SearchParameter, the search must behave as HL7 has defined it.
